results.title: The Red balloon. The Little princess
results.creator_credit: Gene Markey, Films Montsouris, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Albert Lamorisse and Walter Lang
results.brief_description: Two children’s classics have been brought together on this one video. “The Red balloon” won many major awards on its release in 1956. A lonely French boy amazingly becomes friends with a red balloon which follows him to school and protects him in the streets of Paris. An absorbing and quite perfect fantasy. Shirley Temple stars in “The Little princess”, which is adapted from Frances Hodgson Burnett’s tale of an orphan girl who loses her father in the Boer war but has faith that he is still alive. Without ever giving up hope and with a little help from the queen she is finally reunited with him. Songs, dances and a spectacular dream sequence are some of the highlights of this 1939 colour film.

results.title: The Red balloon = Le Ballon rouge
results.brief_description: A small boy finds a balloon which follows him everywhere and fills his need for friendship. When the balloon ultimately lifts the child to the sky, it’s a liberating expression of the freedom of childhood. Based on the story by Albert Lamorisse. No dialogue. (Awards: Academy Award, Best Original Screenplay; Cannes, Best Short Film)

results.title: The Reconstruction of space
results.creator_credit: Center for Humanities and Eve Cotton
results.brief_description: This program highlights a major category of modern art - Cubism - and traces the influence of Cezanne’s cubistic style on Picasso and Braque.

results.title: The Realm of the senses = Ai no corrida [Widescreen] (E)
results.creator_credit: Anatole Dauman, Argos Films, Oshima Productions, Shibata and Nagisa Oshima
results.brief_description: The uncut version of the film which provoked a storm of controversy on its release in 1976 both for its explicit depiction of sex and for the final castration scene. It was banned in a number of countries and deemed obscene in Japan where it was not screened in its uncut form until the twenty-first century. Based on actual events that were suppressed at the time, the plot focuses on the relationship between a brothel owner and a geisha who retreat from the militarist Japan of 1936 into a world of their own where they obsessively act out their sexual fantasies. The film focuses on the shifting power play that takes place between master and servant as the relationship progresses. Oshima deliberately set out to expose the hypocrisy of Japanese censorship laws that banned explicit nudity and pubic hair but allowed sexual violence. Cast includes Eiko Matsuda and Tatsuya Fuji. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Reality of rape
results.creator_credit: Motorola Teleprograms and Averill M Kronick
results.brief_description: A young hitchhiker is picked up on her way to work. We then see a devastatingly powerful recreation of how a rapist “negotiates” for psychological control, as well as the violent act of rape itself. Subsequent scenes involve two officers of varying sensitivity, as they respond to the emotional needs of the victim before proceeding with the preliminary interview. Includes very realistic rape scenes.

results.title: The Realities of recycling
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and United States. Environmental Protection Agency
results.brief_description: Recycling our solid wastes is basic to the protection of our environment. It is the most important single principle which must be incorporated into tomorrow’s solid waste management systems to permit conservation of our resources and easy and economical solid waste disposal. Designed for leaders and technicians who need a more comprehensive grasp of the potential of recycling. Various forms of recycling systems are shown.

results.title: The Real Mobile
results.brief_description: Presents varied attractions of the city of Mobile, Alabama. Shows the city’s family life, historical background, beautiful gardens and includes shots of acrobatic water skiing, swimming, boating, tennis, golf and riding.
